creator: Craig@haquarter.de
text:
Hi,

http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/en/mod/mpm_common.html#maxrequestsperchild
says "Default:	MaxRequestsPerChild 10000"
but Apache 2.2 comes with a config file which says "MaxRequestsPerChild 0". One of those should be fixed, I guess.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
The documentation reflects the compiled-in default when no directive is used in the configuration, it does not document the contents of the default configuration file.

I'd suggest that the compiled-in default being 10k in the absence of the directive is the bogus part, if we suggest a default conf that sets it to 0 everywhere but beos!

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
In trunk, I've made the compiled-in defaults and doc match the default configuration -- 0.
In 2.2.x, I've updated the doc to mention the difference between the compiled-ind efault and a common default configuration.

Thanks for the report.
